title: Spack identifies my Linux CentOS as macos
body:
I'm working on a CentOS Linux system that spack thinks is `macos.`  I can't seem to build most packages that I try -- possibly due to this misidentification:

```
% cat /etc/os-release 
NAME="CentOS Linux"
VERSION="7 (Core)"
ID="centos"
ID_LIKE="rhel fedora"
VERSION_ID="7"
PRETTY_NAME="CentOS Linux 7 (Core)"
ANSI_COLOR="0;31"
CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:centos:centos:7"
HOME_URL="https://www.centos.org/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.centos.org/"

CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT="CentOS-7"
CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT_VERSION="7"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="centos"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="7"
```

```
% spack compiler info intel@16.0.3
intel@16.0.3:
    cc  = /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/bin/intel64/icc
    cxx = /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/bin/intel64/icpc
    f77 = /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/bin/intel64/ifort
    fc  = /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/bin/intel64/ifort
    modules  = []
    operating system  = macos
```

You can see that the operating system is identified as **macos**.  The `arch` command reports the same:

```
% spack arch
darwin-macos-x86_64
```

When I try to compile a package (`metis` in the example below), the build fails because the compiler runtime libraries are not found.  

```
% spack install --dirty -v metis%intel@16.0.3
...
[100%] Linking C executable cmpfillin
ld: warning: libimf.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libsvml.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libirng.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libimf.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libintlc.so.5, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libsvml.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libirng.so, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: warning: libintlc.so.5, needed by ../libmetis/libmetis.so, not found (try using -rpath or -rpath-link)
ld: graphchk: hidden symbol `__intel_cpu_feature_indicator_x' in /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/ipp/../compiler/lib/intel64/libirc.a(cpu_feature_disp.o) is referenced by DSO
ld: final link failed: Bad value
ld: mpmetis: hidden symbol `__intel_cpu_feature_indicator_x' in /projects/opt/intel/compilers/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/ipp/../compiler/lib/intel64/libirc.a(cpu_feature_disp.o) is referenced by DSO
ld: final link failed: Bad value
make[2]: *** [programs/graphchk] Error 1
```

The above error may or may not be caused by OS misidentification. However, it is my understanding that the `--dirty` option should preserve the full environment (including `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`) and  I can cut&paste the cmake/make commands from spack-build.out and the build works fine. This is why I'm thinking the os identification may be causing my trouble. (I'm using the develop branch from Aug. 9.)

Thoughts?
